etymologies: Middle English: the noun partly from Old French point, from Latin punctum ‘something that is pricked’, giving rise to the senses ‘unit, mark, point in space or time’; partly from Old French pointe, from Latin puncta ‘pricking’, giving rise to the senses ‘sharp tip, promontory’. The verb is from Old French pointer, and in some senses from the English noun

definitions: the tapered, sharp end of a tool, weapon, or other object

examples.text: the point of his dagger
a pencil point

shortDefinitions: tapered sharp end of tool etc.

definitions: a pointed flake or blade, especially one that has been worked.
shortDefinitions: pointed flake or blade
pointe

definitions: the tip of a person's chin as a spot for a blow

examples.text: Andrews caught him on the point

shortDefinitions: person's chin as spot for blow

definitions: the prong of a deer's antler

examples.text: a fine buck of eight points

shortDefinitions: prong of deer's antler

definitions: a dot or other punctuation mark, in particular a period.
shortDefinitions: full stop or similar punctuation mark

definitions: a decimal point

examples.text: fifty-five point nine

shortDefinitions: decimal point

definitions: a dot or small stroke used in the alphabets of Semitic languages to indicate vowels or distinguish particular consonants.
shortDefinitions: dot or stroke in Semitic languages to distinguish sounds

definitions: a very small dot or mark on a surface

examples.text: the sky was studded with points of light

shortDefinitions: small dot or mark on surface

definitions: a particular spot, place, or position in an area or on a map, object, or surface

examples.text: turn left at the point where you see a sign to Apple Grove
the furthermost point of the gallery
the check-in point

shortDefinitions: place or position in area or on map etc.

definitions: a particular moment in time or stage in a process

examples.text: from this point onward, the teacher was completely won over

shortDefinitions: moment in time

definitions: the critical or decisive moment

examples.text: when it came to the point he would probably do what was expected of him

shortDefinitions: critical moment

definitions: the verge or brink of (doing or being something)

examples.text: she was on the point of leaving

shortDefinitions: verge or brink of action etc.

definitions: a stage or level at which a change of state occurs

examples.text: it is packed to the bursting point

shortDefinitions: stage at which change of state occurs

definitions: a wall outlet or jack

examples.text: a telephone point

shortDefinitions: socket for connection to electrical supply or communications network

definitions: (in geometry) something having position but not spatial extent, magnitude, dimension, or direction, for example the intersection of two lines.
shortDefinitions: (in geometry) thing having position but not spatial extent

definitions: a single item or detail in an extended discussion, list, or text

examples.text: you ignore a number of important points

shortDefinitions: item in extended discussion or list

definitions: an argument or idea put forward by a person in discussion

examples.text: he made the point that economic regulation involves controls on pricing

shortDefinitions: argument or idea

definitions: the significant or essential element of what is intended or being discussed

examples.text: it took her a long time to come to the point

shortDefinitions: significant element of thing discussed

definitions: advantage or purpose that can be gained from doing something

examples.text: there was no point in denying the truth
what's the point of having things I don't need?

notes.text: in singular, usually with negative or in questions

shortDefinitions: advantage or purpose

definitions: relevance or effectiveness.
shortDefinitions: relevance or effectiveness

definitions: a distinctive feature or characteristic, typically a good one, of a person or thing

examples.text: he has his good points

shortDefinitions: distinctive feature

definitions: (in sports and games) a mark or unit of scoring

examples.text: he scored 13 of his team's final 19 points against Houston

shortDefinitions: (in sport etc.) unit used in scoring

definitions: (in craps) the combination total of the two thrown dice (4, 5, 6, 8, 9, or 10) that permits a shooter to keep throwing until he or she throws the same number again and wins.
shortDefinitions: combination total of two thrown dice that permits shooter to keep throwing until he or she throws same number again and wins

definitions: a unit used in measuring value, achievement, or extent

examples.text: the shares index was down seven points

shortDefinitions: unit used in measuring value etc.

definitions: an advantage or success in an argument or discussion

examples.text: she smiled, assuming she had won her point

shortDefinitions: advantage or success in argument etc.

definitions: a unit of credit toward an award or benefit

examples.text: points were allocated according to the inadequacy of the existing accommodation

shortDefinitions: unit of credit towards award

definitions: a percentage of the profits from a movie or recording offered to certain people involved in its production.
shortDefinitions: percentage of profits from film etc. offered to people involved

definitions: a punishment imposed by the courts for a driving offense and recorded cumulatively on a person's driver's license

examples.text: operating under the influence meant ten points marked up against the driver

shortDefinitions: punishment imposed by courts for driving offense

definitions: (in piquet) the longest suit in a player's hand, containing a specified number of up to eight cards.
shortDefinitions: (in piquet) longest suit in player's hand

definitions: a unit of weight (one hundredth of a carat, or 2 mg) for diamonds.
shortDefinitions: unit of weight for diamonds

definitions: a unit of varying value, used in quoting the price of stocks, bonds, or futures.
shortDefinitions: unit of varying value used in quoting price of stocks etc.

definitions: a value assigned to certain cards (4 points for an ace, 3 for a king, 2 for a queen, and 1 for a jack, sometimes with extra points for long or short suits) by a player in assessing the strength of a hand.
shortDefinitions: value assigned to certain cards

definitions: each of thirty-two directions marked at equal distances around a compass.
shortDefinitions: direction marked on compass

definitions: a direction toward the horizon corresponding to the direction marked on a compass.
shortDefinitions: direction towards horizon

definitions: the angular interval between two successive points of a compass, i.e. one eighth of a right angle (11° 15ʹ).
shortDefinitions: interval between successive points of compass

definitions: unspecified places considered in terms of their direction from a specified place

examples.text: they headed down I-95 to Philadelphia and points south

shortDefinitions: unspecified places in terms of their direction from specified place

definitions: a narrow piece of land jutting out into a lake or ocean

examples.text: the boat came around the point
Sandy Point

shortDefinitions: narrow headland

definitions: a unit of measurement for type sizes and spacing, which in the US and UK is one twelfth of a pica, or 0.013835 inch (0.351 mm), and in Europe is 0.015 inch (0.376 mm).
shortDefinitions: unit of measurement for type sizes

definitions: either of two areas in each attacking zone, just inside the blue line where it meets the boards.
shortDefinitions: area either side of net inside blue line

definitions: a position at the front of the court, usually manned by the guard who sets up the team's defense.
shortDefinitions: position at front of court

definitions: each of a set of electrical contacts in the distributor of a motor vehicle.
shortDefinitions: (in motor vehicle) electrical contact in distributor

definitions: a small leading party of an advanced guard of troops.
shortDefinitions: leading party of advanced guard of troops

definitions: the position at the head of a column or wedge of troops

examples.text: another marine said he would walk point because I had done it on the last patrol

shortDefinitions: position at head of column of troops
point man

definitions: the extremities of an animal, typically a horse or cat, such as the face, paws, and tail of a Siamese cat

examples.text: a pure white dog with black points

shortDefinitions: extremities such as face paws etc. of animal

definitions: a spot to which a straight run is made.
shortDefinitions: spot to which straight run is made

definitions: a straight run

examples.text: our fox made his point to Moorhill

shortDefinitions: straight run

definitions: a tagged piece of ribbon or cord used for lacing a garment or attaching breeches to a doublet.
shortDefinitions: ribbon or cord for lacing garment

definitions: a short piece of cord for tying up a reef in a sail.
shortDefinitions: cord on sail for tying reef

definitions: the action or position of a dog in pointing

examples.text: a bird dog on point

shortDefinitions: action or position of dog in pointing

definitions: an important phrase or subject, especially in a contrapuntal composition.
shortDefinitions: important phrase or subject

crossReferenceMarkers: another term for switch (sense 4 of the noun)

definitions: direct someone's attention toward something by extending one's finger or something held in one's hand

examples.text: the boys were nudging each other and pointing at me
he gripped her arm and pointed to the seat
it's rude to point

shortDefinitions: direct attention towards something by extending finger etc.

definitions: indicate a particular time, direction, or reading

examples.text: a sign pointing left

shortDefinitions: indicate time direction or reading

definitions: direct or aim (something) at someone or something

examples.text: he pointed the flashlight beam at the floor

shortDefinitions: direct or aim something

definitions: face or be turned in a particular direction

examples.text: two of its toes point forward and two point back

shortDefinitions: face particular direction

definitions: (of a dog) indicate the presence of (game) by standing rigid while looking toward it.
shortDefinitions: (of dog) indicate presence of game by standing rigid and looking towards it

definitions: give force or emphasis to (words or actions)

examples.text: he wouldn't miss the opportunity to point a moral

shortDefinitions: give force to

definitions: extend (the toes or feet) in line with the leg by tensing the foot and ankle in such a way as to form a point

examples.text: reach up with your arms and point your toes

shortDefinitions: extend toes to form point

definitions: fill in or repair the joints of (brickwork, a brick structure, or tiling) with smoothly finished mortar or cement

examples.text: the bricks have been poorly pointed

shortDefinitions: fill joints of brickwork or masonry with mortar or cement

definitions: give a sharp, tapered point to

examples.text: he twisted and pointed his mustache

shortDefinitions: give sharp point to

definitions: insert points in (written Hebrew).
shortDefinitions: insert points in Semitic text

definitions: mark (Psalms) with signs for chanting.
shortDefinitions: mark Psalms with signs for chanting
